autodoc¶

Functions

autodoc.build_docs()¶

Builds the HTML documentation for the project using Sphinx and Doxygen.

This function performs the following steps: 1. Defines the paths for the documentation source directory (docs) and the build output directory (_build/html). 2. Ensures the configuration file (conf.py) and Doxyfile exist in the docs directory. 3. Runs Doxygen to generate the XML documentation. 4. Runs the sphinx-build command to generate the HTML documentation. 5. Prints a success message with the location of the generated documentation or an error message if the build fails.

Raises:

FileNotFoundError: If the conf.py or Doxyfile file is not found in the docs directory. subprocess.CalledProcessError: If the doxygen or sphinx-build command fails.

Example:

To build the documentation, simply run the script:

> python autodoc.py
